result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Prakash B Patel

records.addlTxt: Bond reinstated
Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:53 PM Defendant Prakash B Patel in court, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for Prakash B Patel.  Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Deft missed court on 8-16-22.
Bond forfeiture hrg is scheduled on 9-27-22.
Defense indicates deft was in a treatment facility.
These matters are to be consolidated with the deft's felony matter.
State does not object to bond being reinstated.
BTC: VACATE WARRANTS, reinstate bonds, matters adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
In-Custody RCJ
Return on warrant on September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Warrant/capias/commitment entered into all three systems and forwarded to RCSO/Dispatch

Bond forfeiture notice -
     Order forfeiting bail and notice of application for judgment. $50 cash bond; missed hrg 8-16-22
Warrant forwarded to JP for entry.

1:46 PM Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Prakash B Patel not in court.  Attorney McKenna Quinter for Grant Ian Henderson in court for Prakash B Patel. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Defense is not sure where the deft is today.
Defense has tried to call the deft but it is no longer a working number.
Defense would ask any warrant be stayed.
State does not object to a stay.
BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited. - stay 24 hrs.
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:53 PM Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Prakash B Patel in court.  Attorney Ash Castro for Elizabeth Martha Angove in court for Prakash B Patel. 
21CM268 was scheduled for review hearing on Competency.
Deft has not been treated for competency.
Deft has posted bond while waiting to be transported to Mendota for treatment.
Defense counsel has asked to pass the matter while trying to get ahold of the deft's atty.
BACK ON THE RECORD 2:04PM -
Dirk Jensen appears for the State of Wisconsin, all other appearances remain the same.
Defense indicates the deft was now found competent in the CF matters and would ask that the findings be adopted in this case and be set out with the felony matters.
Defense agrees.
These matters will be consolidated with the felony matter.
BTC: Will adopt the findings in the CF matter, deft is now competent, matters adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Review hearing on July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:50 PM Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Prakash B Patel in court, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove in court for Prakash B Patel. Court Reporter:  Amy Schneider. 
21CM268 is scheduled for review hearing on the deft's competency.
Deft has not been transported for treatment.
Defense is requesting a 45 day adjournment.
Deft has also picked up a new file in case 22CM660.
BTC: Matter adjourned.
Review hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State's Notice of Intent to introduce certified public records w/o extrinsic evidence
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Prakash B Patel appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl appeared by video for Prakash B Patel. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Initial appearance on June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
